member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING
member.summary: The DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING enumeration specifies the method that the display uses to create an image on a screen.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_UNSPECIFIED
member.summary: Indicates that scan-line ordering of the output is unspecified. The caller can only set the scanLineOrdering member of the structure in a call to the function to DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_UNSPECIFIED if the caller also set the refresh rate denominator and numerator of the refreshRate member both to zero. In this case, SetDisplayConfig uses the best refresh rate it can find.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_PROGRESSIVE
member.summary: Indicates that the output is a progressive image.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_INTERLACED
member.summary: Indicates that the output is an interlaced image that is created beginning with the upper field.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_INTERLACED_UPPERFIELDFIRST
member.summary: Indicates that the output is an interlaced image that is created beginning with the upper field.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_INTERLACED_LOWERFIELDFIRST
member.summary: Indicates that the output is an interlaced image that is created beginning with the lower field.

member.name: DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING.DISPLAYCONFIG_SCANLINE_ORDERING_FORCE_UINT32
member.summary: Forces this enumeration to compile to 32 bits in size. Without this value, some compilers would allow this enumeration to compile to a size other than 32 bits. You should not use this value.
